process_name: Breach Detection; Assessment; and Notification Process
owner_role: Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Information Security Officer
description: Comprehensive end-to-end process for detecting potential security incidents and breaches involving PHI/ePHI; conducting risk assessments to determine if the breach is reportable under HIPAA; notifying affected individuals; regulators; and media within required timelines; documenting all actions; and conducting post-incident reviews.
business_objective: Ensure timely detection and reporting of security incidents and breaches; minimize impact; comply with regulatory requirements; maintain stakeholder trust
key_activities: Breach detection and triage; risk assessment procedures; determination of reportability; drafting notification letters; obtaining legal and compliance review; sending notifications to individuals; media and HHS notification; documentation and post-incident analysis; root cause analysis
related_data_categories: Unsecured PHI in any category; clinical records; demographic data; financial data; identifiers; sensitive information
required_roles: Incident Response Team; Chief Compliance Officer; Chief Information Security Officer; Privacy Officer; Chief Medical Officer; Legal Counsel; Communications Director; Database Administrators (for investigation)
training_requirements: Annual training; Post-incident training; Role-specific training for incident responders; Tabletop exercises; Incident simulation drills
compliance_basis: 45 CFR 164.400-414 (HIPAA Breach Notification Rule); HITECH Section 13402; HITECH Section 13403; State breach notification laws
risk_mitigation: Rapid detection via SIEM and monitoring; thorough risk assessment procedures; documented assessment criteria; timely notification execution; legal review of determinations; post-incident reviews to identify systemic issues; corrective action tracking
metrics_tracked: Breach detection time; notification completion time; percentage of determinations reviewed by legal; individual notifications sent within SLA; regulatory notifications on time; post-incident review completion
incident_history: 2023-01-15: Unauthorized access attempt (4 records affected; notification completed in 48 hours; no regulatory violation); 2024-03-20: Database query anomaly (1 record; no access confirmed; not reportable); 2024-08-10: Email misdirection (5 records; rapid notification and remediation)
automation_status: Mostly Manual; Semi-automated detection; Workflow system for tracking; Email template system; Notification delivery tracking
sla_hours: Individual notifications: 60 hours maximum; Media notification (if applicable): concurrent with individual; HHS notification: 60 calendar days; Initial breach assessment: 2-4 hours; Post-incident review: 30 days
documentation_level: Comprehensive documentation; Breach case files; Assessment worksheets; Notification templates; Legal review records; Communications log; Post-incident reports; Corrective action plans

owner_role: Chief Medical Officer; Chief Medical Information Officer
supporting_owner: Attending Physicians; Clinical Directors; Nursing Leadership
description: Core clinical process for delivering direct patient care using the EHR system including patient registration; vital sign documentation; clinical assessment; diagnosis; treatment planning; medication ordering; test ordering; results review; documentation; and care coordination; ensures accurate; timely; and HIPAA-compliant capture of clinical information.
business_objective: Deliver high-quality; safe; and compliant patient care; ensure accurate clinical documentation; support clinical decision-making; maintain comprehensive patient records
scope: Enterprise-wide clinical operations; all inpatient; outpatient; and emergency departments
key_activities: Patient registration and scheduling; vital sign capture; chief complaint documentation; history and physical examination; assessment and plan documentation; medication order entry; lab and imaging test ordering; results review and acknowledgment; care plan development; referral management; discharge planning; patient education documentation
related_data_categories: Clinical records; lab results; imaging reports; medication information; patient identifiers; vital signs; diagnoses; treatment plans; notes
required_roles: Physicians; Nurses; Nursing Assistants; Clinical Secretaries; Pharmacists; Laboratory Technicians; Imaging Technicians; Case Managers; Medical Records Staff
training_requirements: Initial onboarding training on EHR; annual HIPAA training; clinical specialty training; system updates training; just-in-time training; competency assessments for critical functions
compliance_basis: 45 CFR 164.308-312 (HIPAA Administrative; Physical; Technical Safeguards); 45 CFR 164.500-510 (HIPAA Privacy Rule); HITECH Section 13405 (Privacy Provisions); State medical practice acts; Joint Commission standards; CLIA regulations (for lab); CMS documentation requirements
risk_mitigation: Minimize documentation errors through templates and decision support; enforce access controls to limit viewing to authorized clinicians; encrypt clinical data at rest and in transit; implement audit logging for clinical data access; train staff on privacy and security; enforce minimum necessary access; implement session timeouts; conduct periodic access reviews; incident response procedures for unauthorized access; corrective action for compliance gaps
metrics_tracked: Average documentation time per encounter; number of medication order errors caught by decision support; percentage of test result acknowledgment within SLA; patient safety incidents related to documentation gaps; unauthorized access attempts to patient records; HIPAA compliance audit findings; staff training completion rates; clinician satisfaction with EHR; clinical quality measures
incident_history: 2023-06-20: Duplicate order entry (caught by alert; patient notified; root cause addressed); 2024-02-15: Late result review (policy reminder sent; turnaround time improvement plan); 2024-07-01: Unauthorized chart access attempt (blocked by access controls; incident investigated); 2024-09-10: Documentation completeness improved with new templates (positive outcome)
automation_status: Fully Automated EHR System; Clinical Decision Support; Order Set Templates; Result Routing Automation; Electronic Alerts for Critical Values; Clinical Workflow Automation; Documentation Templates; Medication Dispensing Integration
frequency_type: Continuous (24/7 for emergency; scheduled for routine)
sla_hours: Routine orders: 48 hours; Emergency orders: immediate; Medications: before dispensing; Lab results: 24 hours for review; Imaging: 48 hours for report; Discharge summaries: 72 hours after discharge
documentation_level: Comprehensive clinical documentation; Clinical templates; Order sets; Workflow procedures; Training materials; Audit logs for clinical access; Incident documentation; Compliance audit reports; Quality metrics reports
